headline.main: Topics of The Times; Fatter and Fatter

docs.lead_paragraph: Americans continue to grow fatter and fatter at rates that are truly alarming. Last July, the National Center for Health Statistics reported that 33 percent of all American adults -- one in every three -- were estimated to be overweight. That was a sharp rise from the already high levels of 24 to 25 percent of all adults recorded as overweight in surveys between 1960 and 1980. Overweight means about 20 percent or more above a person's desirable weight on standard weight tables.
